eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule

Class MPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule.MGeometricObject
      • eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule.MPolygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MGeometricObject>

    public class MPolygon
extends MGeometricObject
    Minuscule polygon. The polygon is a set of vertices (points) connected by edges (lines) to the two neighbor points. To construct a polygon use the method addVertex() to add new vertices. All the edges will be added automatically (which can be turned off).
    Author:
    Augustin Zidek

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MPolygon()
      Creates a new polygon with default properties.

      • getVertex

        public MPoint getVertex(int vertexNo)
        Gets the n-th vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertexNo - The number of the vertex, determined by the order of addition of the vertices.
        Returns:
        The vertex with the given number. Returns null if the argument is negative or greater than the vertices amount.

      • getFillColor

        public java.awt.Color getFillColor()
        Returns:
        The fill color.

      • addVertex

        public MPolygon addVertex(MPoint vertex)
        Adds new vertex to the polygon. The new vertex will be connected by an edge to the previously added vertex and the first vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - The vertex to be added
        Returns:
        The polygon with added vertex

      • addVertex

        public MPolygon addVertex(double x,
                          double y)
        Adds new vertex to the polygon. The new vertex will be connected by an edge to the previously added vertex and the first vertex.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the new vertex
        y - The y coordinate of the new vertex
        Returns:
        The polygon with added vertex

      • deleteVertex

        public MPolygon deleteVertex(int vertexNo)
        Deletes the n-th vertex of the polygon. The order is given by the order in which the vertices have been added.
        Parameters:
        vertexNo - The number of the vertex to be deleted. If vertex with the given number doesn't exist, nothing happens.
        Returns:
        The polygon with deleted vertex. The edges are reconnected automatically.

      • deleteVertex

        public MPolygon deleteVertex(double x,
                             double y)
        Deletes the vertex with the given coordinates. If no such vertex exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the vertex
        y - The y coordinate of the vertex
        Returns:
        The polygon with deleted vertex. The edges are reconnected automatically.

      • draw

        public MPolygon draw(Canvas canvas)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Adds the object into the internal list of objects in the canvas and calls the repaint() method of the Canvas. Any modifications to the geometric object done after calling this method will be ignored (e.g. MPoint.draw(canvas).x(20).y(20);) will draw the point at the default (0, 0) coordinates).
        Specified by:
        draw in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which the object should be drawn
        Returns:
        The object that has been drawn

      • fillColor

        public MPolygon fillColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Changes the fill color. The default fill color is black with alpha = 100. To obtain alpha colors use adequate constructors of Color.
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the filling, alpha = 100 is recommended
        Returns:
        The polygon with modified fill color

      • stroke

        public MPolygon stroke(java.awt.Stroke stroke)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Sets the object's stroke. Stroke modifies the pen that draws the object, e.g. one can modify the thickness of the pen.
        Specified by:
        stroke in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        stroke - The stroke to be used when drawing this object. If not called, default Minuscule Stroke will be used.
        Returns:
        The object which has the given stroke applied
        See Also:
        Stroke

      • layer

        public MPolygon layer(int layer)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Sets the object's layer to the given value. The layer determines when the object is drawn - the higher layer, the later the object will be drawn.
        Specified by:
        layer in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer number
        Returns:
        The object with layer set

      • getLabelBaseCoordinate

        public MCoordinate getLabelBaseCoordinate()
        The base coordinate is calculated as centroid of the polygon (i.e. The centroid of a finite set of k points x1, x2, ..., xk is Base = (x1 + x2 + ... + xk) / k.
        Specified by:
        getLabelBaseCoordinate in class MGeometricObject
        Returns:
        The coordinate of the label base point

      • label

        public MPolygon label(java.lang.String labelText)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Adds a label with default color, default font family and default font size located northeast relative to the object. If the object already has any label, it will be replaced by this label.
        Specified by:
        label in class MGeometricObject

        Returns:

                      double angleDeg)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject

        Specified by:
        label in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        labelText - The label string value
        angleDeg - The angle relative to the x-axis in positive direction at which the label should be placed according to the object's properties
        Returns:
        The object with the label set

      • label

        public MPolygon label(MLabel label)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Adds a custom label to the object, sets the object as its parent. That means that the label coordinates will be now relative to the parent's Label Base Coordinate. If the object already has any label, it will be replaced by this label. If you want the object to determine the label position for you automatically, use either label(String s) method or label(String s, int pos) method.
        Specified by:
        label in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        label - The label to be added to the object
        Returns:
        The object with the label set

      • getLabelCoordinates

        public MCoordinate getLabelCoordinates(double angleDeg)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Returns the relative coordinates for a label of this object at the given angle given in degrees. The method should make sure that the coordinates put the label in such place that it is visually nicely placed relative to the object.
        Specified by:
        getLabelCoordinates in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        angleDeg - The angle at which the label should be put
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the label according to the given angle and the properties of the object

      • getBoundingRectangle

        public MBoundingBox getBoundingRectangle()
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Calculates the bounding rectangle of the given geometric object and returns it. The coordinates are absolute (i.e. relative to the origin, not to the parent object).
        Specified by:
        getBoundingRectangle in class MGeometricObject
        Returns:
        The bounding rectangle of the geometric object.
